thread.title: Franklin Bass to Lead Simmons Bank in Hot Springs
thread.title_full: Franklin Bass to Lead Simmons Bank in Hot Springs

title: Franklin Bass to Lead Simmons Bank in Hot Springs
text:
by Arkansas Business Staff on Thursday, Sep. 24, 2015 11:49 am 
Simmons First National Bank this week named Franklin Bass as its Hot Springs community president. 
Bass, an Arkadelphia native, joined Simmons in 2014 as a senior vice president and lending manager in Hot Springs. He had previously worked for Crews & Associates in Little Rock, First Security Bank in Fayetteville and Summit Bank in Hot Springs. 
Bass is a member of the board of the Arkansas Game & Fish Foundation and the Mid-America Science Museum at Hot Springs. He is also on the steering committee of the Hot Springs Future Fund. 
"Hot Springs is a key growth market for Simmons Bank," said Freddie Black, Simmons’ regional chair for Arkansas. "Franklin has strong leadership skills, a great personality and understands how to deliver customer service. We also like our community presidents to be involved in the community, and Franklin is heavily involved. We couldn’t have a better leader in the Hot Springs market."
